analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The Direction of Order and the Direction of the Roots, the Triad and Dyad, the Text in Sections

original: 16.66. Sanidassanattika, Cittaduka🔽Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ cittaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanaappaṭigho nocitto dhammo
analyzed: sani dassana ttika citta duka  anidassana appaṭigham cittam dhammam paṭicca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ no cittaḥ dhammo
translated: With Object, the Mind Dyad🔽With a non-cognizable, non-impactable mind element as condition there arises a non-cognizable, non-impactable mental datum.

original: uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ cittaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho🔽nocitto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …pe… anidassanaappaṭighaṁ cittaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca
analyzed: uppajjati hetu paccayā anidassana appaṭigham cittam dhammam paṭicca na sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ  no cittaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pe anidassana appaṭigham cittam dhammam paṭicca
translated: With a non-cognizable, non-impactable mind element as condition there arises a cognizably-impactable mental datum.

original: nasanidassanasappaṭigho nocitto ca naanidassanasappaṭigho nocitto ca dhammā uppajjanti
analyzed: na sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ no cittaḥ ca na anidassana sa paṭighaḥ no cittaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti
translated: With a non-cognizable, non-impactable mind element as condition there arises a cognizably-impactable mental datum and a non-cognizable, non-impactable mental datum.

original: hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: (In brief.) In the case of cause, there are six; in the case of object, there are three; … in the case of dissociation, there are six.

original: Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ nocittaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho nanocitto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: anidassana appaṭigham no cittam dhammam paṭicca na sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ na no cittaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With a non-cognizable, non-impactable mental datum as condition there arises a cognizably-impactable mental datum. (In brief.) In the case of cause, there are three; … in the case of dissociation, there are three.
